episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the play behavior of squids, the mafia's control over baby artichokes in 1930s New York, the unique job of stickmen in Chongqing, and the KLF's infamous burning of a million pounds.

facts.fact: In 1935, New York issued a total ban on the possession or supply of baby artichokes.
Until recently, in the Chinese city of Chongqing, you could hail down a stickman to carry your bags by shouting, "Bangman!"
In 1994, the music group, the KLF, burnt one million pounds.
